name.value: FHIR Connectathon 17 - Scheduling - Typical Appointment Flow Tests - JSON - Server Id

description.value: FHIR Scheduling Services Tests - JSON - Server Assigned Resource Id - Typical flow of statuses for an appointment.
Create, Delete, Read, Update Operations
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure the Patient does not exist on the server.
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure the Practitioner does not exist on the server.
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure Slot 6 does not exist on the server.
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure Slot 5 does not exist on the server.
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure Slot 4 does not exist on the server.
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure Slot 3 does not exist on the server.
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure Slot 2 does not exist on the server.
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure Slot 1 does not exist on the server.
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure the Schedule does not exist on the server.
Create the Practitioner and Patient resource to be used as the schedule actors and appointment participants.
Step 1.1 - Create the Practitioner resource to be the Schedule's actor and Appointment's participant.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 201(Created).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Complex ruleset assertion to conditionally validate expected versioning HTTP Headers.
Complex ruleset assertion to conditionally validate expected create ok response HTTP Headers and body.

Step 1.1a - Search for the created Practitioner by the unique identifier. This is necessary in order to determine the server assigned resource id and requires the desination server to also support the identifier search parameter.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Validate that the returned resource conforms to the base FHIR Bundle profile.
Confirm that returned bundle first entry contains the created version of the Practitioner.
Step 1.2 - Create the Patient resource to be the Appointment's participant.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 201(Created).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Complex ruleset assertion to conditionally validate expected versioning HTTP Headers.
Complex ruleset assertion to conditionally validate expected create ok response HTTP Headers and body.

Step 1.2a - Search for the created Patient by the unique identifier. This is necessary in order to determine the server assigned resource id and requires the desination server to also support the identifier search parameter.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Validate that the returned resource conforms to the base FHIR Bundle profile.
Confirm that returned bundle first entry contains the created version of the Patient.
Create the Schedule and Slot resources to be referenced by the Appointment.
Step 2.1 - Create a Schedule resource for the Practitioner for one day.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 201(Created).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Complex ruleset assertion to conditionally validate expected versioning HTTP Headers.
Complex ruleset assertion to conditionally validate expected create ok response HTTP Headers and body.

Step 2.1a - Search for the created Schedule by the unique identifier. This is necessary in order to determine the server assigned resource id and requires the desination server to also support the identifier search parameter.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Validate that the returned resource conforms to the base FHIR Bundle profile.
Confirm that returned bundle first entry contains the created version of the Schedule.
Step 2.2.1 - Create the Slot 1 resource for the Schedule for 9:00am.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 201(Created).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Complex ruleset assertion to conditionally validate expected versioning HTTP Headers.
Complex ruleset assertion to conditionally validate expected create ok response HTTP Headers and body.

Step 2.2.1a - Search for the created Slot 1 by the unique identifier. This is necessary in order to determine the server assigned resource id and requires the desination server to also support the identifier search parameter.

Confirm that returned bundle first entry contains the created version of the Slot.
Confirm that the returned bundle first entry contains the expected start datetime value.
Confirm that the returned bundle first entry contains the expected end datetime value.

Search for first free Slot. The search for a free Slot is the precursor to creating a new Appointment.
Step 3.1 - Prior to searching for a free Slot, the correct Schedule must be found via a search. Parameters are Practitioner, Date and Service Type.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that there is one record returned. The Schedule created in Step 2 is expected to be the only match.
Confirm that the Bundle total value matches the number of entries in the Bundle
Confirm that returned bundle first entry contains the expected and matched Schedule.
Step 3.2 - Search for a free Slot within the found Schedule. Parameters are Schedule, Slot Type and Status.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that there is at least one record returned. All Slots created in Step 2 are expected to match.
Confirm that the Bundle total value matches the number of entries in the Bundle
